title: PDP chairmanship: Nigeria drifting to one party state —Gov Emmanuel | Nigerian News Headlines Today | Breaking Newspapers News
text:
tweet 
By Emmanuel Ayungbe 
U YO —Governor Udom Emmanuel of Akwa Ibom State has warned that the current political development in the country was a pointer to the fact that the country was drifting to a one party state, saying it was dangerous to the nation’s democratic advancement. 
Governor Emmanuel stated this at the Ibom International Airport on arrival from Abuja, where he attended the Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, stakeholders meeting following last week’s Appeal Court ruling, which ordered parties to maintain status quo and Sen Ali Modu Sheriff, returning as National Chairman of the PDP. Gov Emmanuel Udom 
He said democracy would be jeopardised in the seeming one party structure, which the country was pursuing, and in the circumstance, the system would stifle the voice of the opposition, thereby paving the way for despotism which he said was not in the best interest of the…
